class IntertoperabilityLevel
An item that is contained inside an Asset, e.g. an individual term in a vocabulary, an individual code in a code list or some other ‘atomic’ element of an Asset class Item
Used in RADion to provide descriptive text for the Repository, Asset or Distribution.

docblock.description: Default constructor
class PeriodOfTime
Default constructor
class RepresentationTechnique
Default constructor

A Semantic Asset in the model is an abstract entity that reflects the intellectual content of the asset and represents those characteristics of the asset that are independent of its physical embodiment.
docblock.long-description: This abstract entity combines the FRBR entities work (a distinct intellectual or artistic creation) and expression (the intellectual or artistic realization of a work). Assets can be versioned. Every time the intellectual content of an asset changes, the result is considered to be a new asset that can be linked to previous and next versions of the Asset. The physical embodiment of an Asset is called a Distribution. A particular Asset may have zero or more Distributions. class SemanticAsset

docblock.description: Links a Semantic Asset to relevant Contact Information which is provided using VCard.
Used in ADMS to link to the main documentation or specification of the Asset.
Used in ADMS to link to a Web page that is fully dedicated to the Asset.
ADMS uses this to provide any identifier for the Asset.
Links to a Semantic Asset that is contained in the Asset being described, e.g. when there are several vocabularies defined in a single document.
Links a Semantic Asset to an item that is contained within it (e.g. a concept in a controlled vocabulary).
Links a resource to its adms:InteroperabilityLevel .
docblock.long-description: Since this is encoded using skos:Concept, that is the defined range for this property.

docblock.description: The date of the most recent update of the metadata for the Asset
Links to the language of the metadata for the Asset.
docblock.long-description: The range of adms:metadataLanguage is dcterms:LinguisticSystem which is used by RADion (and therefore ADMS) to represent the Language class.

docblock.description: Links to the organisation making the metadata for the Asset available.
docblock.long-description: The range of adms:metadataPublisher as dcterms:Agent which is used by RADion, and therefore ADMS, for the Publisher class.

docblock.description: Links to documentation that contains information related to the asset.
docblock.long-description: The range of adms:relatedDocumentation is foaf:Document

docblock.description: Links to a Web page that contains information related to the asset.
Links to a sample of the Semantic Asset (which is itself a Semantic Asset, i.e the range is adms:Asset).
Links to the status of the Asset or Distribution in the context of a particular workflow process.
docblock.long-description: Since Status is defined using a skos:Concept, that is the defined range for this property.

docblock.description: Used in ADMS to link to the Period of Time class.
Links to a translation of the Semantic Asset (which is itself a Semantic Asset, i.e the range is adms:Asset).
Used in ADMS to link an Asset to its Asset Type.

docblock.description: The dcterms:Agent class (or a sub class of it) is used in RADion to represent the publisher of a Repository or its components.
docblock.long-description: class Agent

docblock.description: RADion uses this to provide the name or label of any class.
Used in RADion to link a Licence or Publisher to its type.
Default constructor
An Asset represents the conceptual content of a resource.
docblock.long-description: A particular Asset may have zero or more Distributions in different formats. class Asset

docblock.description: Used in RADion to provide an alternative name for the Asset: this information may be used to provide additional access points, e.g. allowing indexing of any acronyms, nicknames, shorthand notations or other identifying information that a user might expect to find the Asset under.
RADion uses the XHTML 'last' property to link an Asset to the most recent (i.e. current) version.
RADion uses this to provide the creation date of this version of the Repository, Asset or Distribution.
docblock.long-description: RADion expects a datatyped value and for it to be conformant with ISO 8601, preferably using an xsd data type.

docblock.description: RADion uses this to provide the date of latest update of the Repository, Asset or Distribution.
docblock.long-description: RADion expects a datatyped value and for it to be conformant with ISO 8601, preferably using an xsd data type

docblock.description: Used in RADion to provide descriptive text for the Repository, Asset or Distribution.
The distribution relationship associates an Asset (its domain) with a Distribution (its range). It is the inverse of distributionOf
A word or phrase used to succinctly descibe the Asset
RADion uses this to provide the language of the Asset.
RADion uses this to provide the name
RADion uses the XHTML 'next' property to link an Asset to the next most recent version.
RADion uses the XHTML 'previous' property to link an Asset to the previous version.
Used in RADion to link to the organisation responsible for the publication of the Asset, Repository or Distribution.
Used in RADion to link any Asset to any other related Asset.
docblock.long-description: RADion expects the object to be of type rad:Asset.

docblock.description: RADion uses dcterms:isPartOf to link an Asset to a Repository.
RADion uses this to link to the geographic region or jurisdiction that the Asset or Repository applies to
The theme relationship associates an Asset with a specific Theme.
docblock.long-description: Themes are typically, but not necessarily, encoded as a skos:Concept, arranged in a skos:ConceptScheme.

docblock.description: The version number or other designation of the Asset; the value should be a free text string
Notes on the particular version of the Asset.
The Conceptual Model includes a 'Code' datatype that is used by several classes.
docblock.long-description: This is expressed using the SKOS vocabulary with a particular 'code' usually being a skos:Concept that is part of a scheme. The intention is that the skos:Concept class be used as follows; class code

docblock.description: A Distribution is a particular representation or concretisation of an Asset in the form of a downloadable computer file that implements the intellectual content of an Asset. A particular Distribution is typically associated with one Asset.
docblock.long-description: class Distibution

docblock.description: RADion uses this to provide the creation date of this Distribution.
docblock.long-description: RADion expects a datatyped value and for it to be conformant with ISO 8601

docblock.description: RADion uses this to provide the date of latest update of the Distribution.
docblock.long-description: RADion expects a datatyped value and for it to be conformant with ISO 8601

docblock.description: Used in RADion to provide descriptive text for the Distribution.
The distributionOf relationship associates a Distribution (its domain) with the Asset (its range) of which it is a Distribution.
docblock.long-description: It is the inverse of distribution

docblock.description: Used in RADion to link to the format that the Distribution is available in (e.g. PDF, XML, RDF/XML, HTML) which is provided as a property of dcterms:FileFormat
Used in RADion to link to the conditions or restrictions for (re-use) of the Distribution. Note that the range is dcterms:LicenseDocument
RADion uses this to provide the name of the class
Used in RADion to link to the organisation responsible for the publication of the Asset, Repository or Distribution.
docblock.long-description: Note that the range is dcterms:Agent.

docblock.description: class FileFormat
class GeographicCoverage
Used in RADion to provide descriptive text for the Repository, Asset or Distribution.
RADion uses this to provide the name or label of any class.
docblock.long-description: For technical compatibility, we need to use $name attribute

docblock.description: class Language

Used in RADion to provide the conditions or restrictions that apply to the use of a Distribution, e.g. whether it is in the public domain, or that some restrictions apply like in cases attribution is required, or the Asset can only be used for non-commercial purposes etc.
docblock.long-description: class License

docblock.description: A Repository is a system or service that provides facilities for storage and maintenance of descriptions of Assets and Distributions.
docblock.long-description: A Repository will typically contain descriptions of several Assets and functionality that allows users to search and access these descriptions. The Distributions - the actual files themselves - will typically be available from the Repository or elsewhere on the World Wide Web.

docblock.description: RADion uses this to provide the creation date of this version of the Repository, Asset or Distribution.
docblock.long-description: RADion expects a datatyped value and for it to be conformant with ISO 8601, preferably using an xsd data type.

docblock.description: RADion uses this to provide the date of latest update of the Repository, Asset or Distribution.
docblock.long-description: RADion expects a datatyped value and for it to be conformant with ISO 8601, preferably using an xsd data type

docblock.description: Used in RADion to provide descriptive text for the Repository, Asset or Distribution.
The assets which are included into this repository

Used in RADion to link to the organisation responsible for the publication of the Asset, Repository or Distribution.
The theme relationship associates an Asset with a specific Theme and theme taxonomy does the same job for the repository as a whole.
RADion uses this to link to the geographic region or jurisdiction that the Asset or Repository applies to
